body_content.explanation: in American football, a defender (= a player who tries to prevent the other team from scoring) whose job is to stop an attacking player from catching and running with the ball, and who plays on the side of the field where the strongest attacking players are in the opposing team, or this position in a team:
examples: They'll be without their best defensive player, strong safety Rob Johnson.
He started all 12 games at strong safety.
This year he'll get a chance to shine from the strong safety position.
